name: Makara Mela
description: Celebrated during Makara Sankranti (January) at Singhanath Temple, featuring rituals, music, dance, and stalls with crafts and food.

name: Rath Yatra
description: A vibrant chariot festival in June/July at the Jagannath Temple, with decorated chariots, devotional songs, and Odissi dance.

name: Durga Puja & Kali Puja
description: Held in October/November at Dakhinakali Temple, with pandals, Gotipua dance, and processions honoring Goddesses Durga and Kali.

name: Pakhala Bhata
description: Fermented rice served with curd, vegetables, or fish curry, a cooling staple enjoyed especially in summer.

name: Chhena Poda
description: A roasted cottage cheese dessert with a caramelized flavor, popular during festivals and celebrations.

name: Sambalpuri Sarees
description: Intricate ikat-woven sarees in vibrant colors, worn by women during festivals and ceremonies.

name: Dhokra Art
description: Tribal metal-casting craft using lost-wax technique, creating figurines and jewelry sold in markets and festivals.

name: Pattachitra
description: Traditional scroll paintings depicting mythological stories, crafted by artisans in nearby villages.

name: Odissi & Gotipua Dance
description: Classical Odissi and traditional Gotipua dances performed during festivals, narrating divine stories with graceful movements.
